author: volibra
title: Ada payment link generator
description: ウェブサイトなしでデジタル製品をオンラインで販売するためのエイダ支払いリンクジェネレータの欠如

f6_assessments.q0: Superb use case for the low-budget dApps and integrations challenge! Of course it's a "competitor" for Coti's ADA Pay (https://adapay.finance/) but alternatives an options are always good to have. Moreover, if this can bridge Cardano to Meta's Diem and their soon 3 billion users, I would say it's worth a shot.
f6_assessments.q1: Seems like a capable team confident in producing results in a matter of few months. Looking at Github (https://github.com/cardano-foundation/CIPs/tree/master/CIP-0013) you can see that the work is already underway and this funding would just accelerate getting the results.
f6_assessments.q2: 35.7 hours of UI Design and 21.4 hours for testing are very specific numbers. Either the guys have mastered a clockwork-like agile process or this is an attempt to make a lump sum appear more granular. Still, for such quick project the plan is somewhat sufficient. It appears Volibra is only going to build the technical solution and then it's up to other teams to go and commercialize its use. Looking forward to see what's coming up next from this team.

f6_assessments.q0: They are right that there is a lack of link generators for ada payments. This will be a mini decentralized app so it is perfect for this challenge as well as it would be a good and usefull dapp for users who want to make easily payments using cardano blockchain
f6_assessments.q1: They provide a roadmap which is not very detailed but there is also a link with extra information about the plan. I have check it and the plan presented there has a lot of details explained. Also the information about the team members is very clear and is good to see linkedin profiles to be sure that they are what they say that they are
f6_assessments.q2: They provide information to audit the progress in a list explaining what they are going to do in each of the 3 months of development. Also some success metrics are written, they are measurable so they are useful for auditng the progress of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer addresses the problem of not having enough Cardano Payment Links generators to sell online digital goods without a platform. The proposal clearly addresses the way to overcome the problem by a Cardano Payment Links Generator
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has proven experience and has the required skills to make this proposal a reality.
The proposal consists of a clear plan and a road map even though is brief, is quite self-explanatory. The requested amount of 10k USD for the challenge seems reasonable.
With everything given the chances of the proposal being implemented successfully are high.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal comes with a detailed roadmap for each month and KPI that helps auditors to track the progress of the proposal.  The milestones and success definition at the end of 1, 2, and 3 months do not seem to be a overestimate. The clear budget distribution also helps auditors. Based on all this provided information it would be possible to track the development of the proposal successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications:  in my year long work in political organisations I have been both a treasurer of a political organisation and a financial auditor (someone that checks the books of an organisation to verify that all the funds proceedings are in order). Hence, can bring in some competencies in evaluating the budgets in this category on their credibility and accountability. In programming specific costs in budgets I draw my knowledge from research and university education in programming but not personal professional experience in the field of IT, hence this part of my assesments in this categeory will be more superficial and more focused on the general budget rationale with the research done in mind. The proposal identifies a problem within general crypto accessibility the solving of which would benefit Cardano.With the background info from the other proposal, it clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
The key metrics and goals of the proposal are only partially formulated explicitly, but where they are they do align with the outlined challenge settings.
The proposal in its whole makeup, if similar to the referenced one, is probably able to scale to address future challenges. Feedback: This is generally a good, however short proposal and would get five stars, but you missed formulating your own implementation plan. Just linking the implementetion plan from another similar proposal does not show the exact makeup of what YOU will deliver. Try adding this next time as well
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers are very transparent about their background and seem competent and up to the task. They provide extensive documentation of their qualifications. It is highly likely they are up to the challenge The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic schedule to complete the work, that could however be a bit more detailed.
In general, the plan could be a bit more detailed. Since this is a mini-proposal, it's not that bad however, especially considering you provide a more detailed description via a past proposal.
The resources necessary to implement the proposal are described. The only critiques in my opinion are that no plan for risks in implementation or for lack of funding are presented. A big plus is that one can easily red up some of the tehnical details from the provided link to a past proposal. Feedback: Do a bit of risk assessments for potential problems in your implementation and you'll be fine

Success metrics and KPIs that are auditable are presented.
The targeted problem and solution are described, however the solution could be described in more detail to make the proposal perfectly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is within the challenge settings and the use case could quickly reach a large use base if well designed and executed. (Score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q1: Volibra has well-defined the solution and seems to have all the skills, capacity and methodology required to successfully deliver on the promise. Only drawback is the lack of identified risks and proposed mitigations. (Score given: 4)
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is clear and to the point. It could benefit from detailing how the proposed KPIs will be made easy for the community to track over time. (Score given: 4)
